    public abstract class BaseServiceSecurity
extends java.lang.Object
implements ServiceSecurity
    Base class for implementations of service security layer
    Author:
    luis

      • addToFetch

        protected Relationship[] addToFetch(Relationship[] fetch,
                        Relationship... toAdd)
        adds a Relationship to a fetch list. If it already is present, it is not added. Comes in handy with load methods.
        Parameters:
        fetch - Relationship... to which the tobeAdded Relationship is added.
        toAdd - The Relationship to be added.
        Returns:
        an array of Relationships with the original array plus the newly added.

      • checkHasUser

        protected void checkHasUser()
        It checks if there is a logged user

      • checkIsSystem

        protected void checkIsSystem()
        performs a check if the logged user is the system. To be called from methods which are only to be run via system.
        Throws:
        PermissionDeniedException - in case the logged user isn't system.

      • getPermissionServiceLocal

        protected PermissionServiceLocal getPermissionServiceLocal()

      • getSession

        protected org.hibernate.Session getSession()

      • getSessionFactory

        protected org.hibernate.SessionFactory getSessionFactory()

      • hasPermission

        protected boolean hasPermission(Permission... permissions)
        Returns:
        if the logged user has or not at least one of the requested permissions

      • hasPermissionFor

        protected boolean hasPermissionFor(Permission permission,
                       Entity... required)
        Returns:
        if the logged user has permission for all required entities

      • load

        protected <T extends Entity> T load(java.lang.Class<T> type,
                        java.lang.Long id)
